documents.document: We are investing nearly 30 million to test vaccines against COVID-19 variants, helping protect the UK from future outbreaks. https://t.co/XfLTzBEyUp https://t.co/NXVKAvl2fZ

Work in lockstep to tackle threats to our shared security. The UKs Carrier Strike Group will visit India later this year and our navies will undertake joint training exercises to enable future cooperation on operations in the Western Indian Ocean. [6/6] https://t.co/w9NYWxQwvO

Increase cooperation between British and Indian universities in areas like health, emerging technologies and climate science. A new Migration and Mobility partnership will also make it easier for Indian students and skilled professionals to study, work and live in the UK. [5/6] https://t.co/cTQkRp74fJ

Agreeing an Enhanced Trade Partnership that deepens the UK-India economic relationship and beginning negotiations on a Free Trade Agreement that will double trade between our two countries over the next decade. [4/6] https://t.co/1vzBJQQ0V1
Working together to accelerate the development of clean energy and transport, protect biodiversity and help developing countries adapt to the impact of climate change. [3/6] https://t.co/V7DzAorCOB

Expanding the UK-India health partnership and improving international supply chains to ensure critical medicines, vaccines and other medical products reach those who need them most. [2/6] https://t.co/BIYJlQBksY
Today Prime Ministers @BorisJohnson and @NarendraModi agreed a 2030 Roadmap for UK-India relations. Here are some of the things it commits us to [THREAD 1/6]
RT @BorisJohnson: Today @NarendraModi and I spoke about how we can overcome the pandemic and strengthen the ties between our two countries.
More than 6,500 new jobs will be created around the UK thanks to 1 billion of new UK-India trade and investment. https://t.co/r60dmQu4U6 https://t.co/BXZJQwC5DG
RT @FCDOGovUK: G7 foreign ministers meet today in London for the first face-to-face #G7 Foreign Ministers Meeting in more than two years.
The legal limit on the number of mourners at funerals will be lifted in England at Step 3 of the Roadmap, so family and friends can pay their respects in greater numbers. https://t.co/r4Y80NYbG5
The Prime Ministers message on Northern Irelands centenary year. https://t.co/g8CgvNeehL

We are playing our part in the fight against the coronavirus surge in India: Sending 1,000 more ventilators to help the most severely affected @CMO_England providing advice and expertise to his Indian counterpart Find out more https://t.co/vYj3Dp8CSU https://t.co/gmaktUGmnj
Happy #OrthodoxEaster to those celebrating today. https://t.co/LrGKNAg9cn

We have recruited , new police officers, beating our target of putting , more officers on our streets in the first year of our recruitment drive. Over years, we'll recruit , police officers to cut crime and keep our communities safe. https://t.co/KDBTRRxMRR

The Vaccines Taskforce has secured an extra 60 million doses of the Pfizer/BioNTech vaccine. The extra doses will help support preparations for the COVID-19 vaccine booster programme from the autumn. https://t.co/RCju7Kc4Wn https://t.co/Ely1sXabXZ

On this day 300 years ago, Sir Robert Walpole (1676-1745) became the First Lord of the Treasury and, in effect, Britains first Prime Minister. He remains the longest holder of this office, serving 21 years. Read more about Britains first PM here: https://t.co/1eWZs9hycY https://t.co/eziJB0TXjr
